Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Lagerkvist, C.-I., A.W. Harris, and V. Zappala, Asteroid Lightcurve Parameters, in Asteroids II, edited by R.P. Binzel, T. Gehrels, and M.S. Matthews, pp. 1162-1179, Univ. of Arizona Press, Tucson, 1989.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: A compilation of published lightcurve- derived parameters for asteroids.
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: A compilation of published lightcurve- derived parameters for asteroids.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This is a compilation of published lightcurve results up through February 2000. This compilation is maintained by Alan Harris, JPL.
Modification History -------------------- The lc data set was first introduced into PDS at the April 1994 asteroid datasets review. It was subsequently updated at the March 1996 review, the April 1999 review, and the June 2000 review.
Parameters ========== This data set includes one entry for each asteroid for which lightcurve observations have been made. Each entry gives the following parameters: rotation period; minimum and maximum amplitude of lightcurve; reliability code; and references to the published papers reporting the observations.
Data ==== The derived lightcurve data are provided in the file 'LC.TAB'.
Ancillary Data ============== The data file gives reference codes indicating the published papers reporting lightcurve observations on each asteroid. The full citations corresponding to these codes are given in the file 'LCREF.TAB'.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note:
Confidence Level Overview ========================= The confidence level of each entry in the data set is indicated by a quality code. This quality code is described in the associated data label, 'LC.LBL'.
Review ====== This data set underwent external peer review on June 1, 2000.
